business.headline: Rupee not falling against any currency other than US dollar: Nirmala SitharamanFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman rejected criticism of the rupee's decline, stating it remains stable against most currencies despite a stronger US dollar. She attributed volatility to global factors and highlighted India's strong macroeconomic fundamentals.

Gone bananas! Most Kerala tea-time snacks come under 18% GST From 'pazhampori' to 'ada' and 'undam pori,' beloved Malayali tea-time snacks find themselves caught in the bewildering GST maze. These humble delicacies come with an 18 per cent GST tag, all because they do not have the required 'classification' to be put elsewhere.

Harley-Davidson bikes to get cheaper as Centre cuts tariff amid Trump threatDonald Trump has consistently pushed for reducing trade barriers, especially on products that the US manufactures, and the high tariff on Harley-Davidson has been a point of contention in the past.
Increased TDS limit, exemption for NSS: Big relief for senior citizens Budget 2025 announced major tax reforms for senior citizens, reducing their tax burden and giving a boost to their savings.

Will boost savings, investment, consumption, growth: PM on BudgetPrime Minister Narendra Modi praised the Union Budget 2025, calling it a "force multiplier" that will boost savings, investment, consumption, and growth.
TDS reforms announced, limit for senior citizens doubledBudget 2025: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced an increase in the TDS threshold in the Union Budget 2025.

Everyone's praising you, Budget is very good: PM praises Nirmala SitharamanThe Prime Minister walked up to the bench where Nirmala Sitharaman was seated and expressed his gratitude for presenting her eighth and the Modi 3.0 government's first Budget today.

No tax payable up to Rs 12 lakh income: Budget bonanza for middle classFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced that taxpayers with salaries up to Rs 12 lakh would not be required to pay tax in the new tax regime. Sitharaman also proposed changes in the slab structure of the new income tax regime.
New Income Tax Bill next week, will focus on easing taxpayer convenience: Finance MinisterFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman to unveil new Income Tax Bill next week.
Boost for MSMEs, classification investment cap to be hiked 2.5 times The Indian government would strengthen the country's MSME sector.

Middle class hero with massive tax relief, Bihar big beneficiaryFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced big reforms focused on income tax relief for the middle class in addition to major reforms in agriculture, with Bihar in focus.

Budget for common man, says PM Modi at Cabinet meet: SourcesBudget 2025-2026 is likely to provide a much-needed boost to the middle class amid high inflation with the nation's GDP growth projected to slow down to a four-year low of 6.4 per cent.

Will stock market investors get tax relief from this budget?Capital gains tax and stock market investors: Experts anticipate that Budget 2025 should not announce new taxes, instead, provide tax rebates to boost the consumption levels and revive market sentiment.

Sensex gains over 300 points, Nifty goes past 23,600  Live UpdatesStock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex was up by 278.80 points to 77,779.37, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 81.80 points to 23,590.20 as of 11:29 AM.

Use this income tax calculator to check your tax outgo under both regimesCalculate income tax online: Experts suggest that 'Modi 3.0' may introduce measures to make the new income tax regime more appealing to taxpayers.

Commercial LPG cylinder rates slashed by Rs 7 ahead of Union BudgetThe rate of 19 kg commercial LPG cylinders has been reduced by Rs 7 ahead of the Union Budget 2025-26. A commercial LPG cylinder will now be available in Delhi for Rs 1,797.

Budget 2025: Is stock market open for trading today?Stock market today: The Budget is one of the most important events for the stock market, with policy changes and fiscal measures often leading to sharp movements in stock prices.
India must grow at 8% for at least 10 years for 'Viksit Bharat': Economic SurveyThe Indian economy is expected to grow between 6.3% to 6.8% in FY26, according to the Economic Survey.

Why middle class can expect tax relief todayUnion Budget 2025 Expectations: The government is likely to roll out schemes that focus on offering economic and tax relief to the middle class, poor and women.

Sensex, Nifty rally as markets ride consumer goods wave ahead of BudgetSensex Nifty rise ahead of Budget 2025: The S&P BSE Sensex surged 740.76 points to end at 77,500.57, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 258.90 points to close at 23,508.40.

entertainment.headline: Ricky Kej to Anoushka Shankar: Meet Indian origin artistes nominated for Grammys 2025Several Indian musicians and artists of Indian origin have been nominated for the 2025 Grammy Awards. This includes seasoned winners like Ricky Kej and Anoushka Shankar, alongside newcomers such as Varijashree Venugopal.

Old clips of Udit Narayan kissing Alka Yagnik, Shreya Ghoshal go viral amid backlashVeteran singer Udit Narayan is under fire after videos of him kissing female fans at events surfaced online. Amid the backlash, old clips of him kissing Alka Yagnik and Shreya Ghoshal are going viral.

Raghav Chadha jams with Mika Singh on Something Something at Delhi rallyAAP leader Raghav Chadha was seen jamming with singer Mika Singh during a political rally in Delhi. The duo performed a popular track amid the ongoing election campaign.
Singer Millind Gaba, wife Pria Beniwal announce pregnancy: Our hearts are fullSinger Millind Gaba and his wife Pria Beniwal are expecting their first child. They got married in 2022.

Netflix's The Sandman cancelled, to end with Season 2The production of The Sandman has been cancelled following sexual harassment allegations against creator Neil Gaiman. Despite this, Netflix will still release season two in 2025.

Shark Tank's Kunal Bahl reflects on pricing differences between iPhone, AndroidIn an exclusive chat, Kunal Bahl addressed the ongoing debate about app pricing differences on Android and iOS. He also shared insights on the impact of online shopping in India.

Tillotama Shome on 'misrepresentation, under-representation' of Northeast IndiaActor Tillotama Shome spoke to India Today in an exclusive interview about playing Meghna Barua in Paatal Lok 2. The actor talked about how Indian cinema 'misrepresents' and 'under-represents' Northeast India.

Cult of Fear – Asaram Bapu review: A fair look at rise and fall of notorious GodmanReleased-Wed Jan 29, 2025In Cult of Fear-Asaram Bapu, you see the testimonies of Bapu's followers, the victims of his cult, journalists and researchers trying to explain how he did what he did.

Singer Udit Narayan on controversy over kissing female fans: Hum decent log haiVideos of singer Udit Narayan kissing female fans on the lips during a live performance went viral. Now, the singer has addressed the controversy and called it fans' 'deewangi', and said it shouldn't be given so much attention.

Stunning pics from Raftaar-Manraj's Sikh and South Indian wedding ceremoniesRapper Raftaar married fashion stylist Manraj Jawanda in a dual wedding ceremony recently. The two shared a few dreamy pictures from their two weddings on social media.

Ibrahim Ali Khan-Khushi Kapoor ready for 'Nadaaniyan' in his debut Netflix filmIbrahim Ali Khan announced his debut film, titled Nadaaniyan, with Khushi Kapoor on Saturday. It's a Netflix film directed by Shauna Gautam.

Chris Martin's new video from Maha Kumbh goes viral as he takes holy dip at SangamColdplay's Chris Martin and Dakota Johnson were seen taking a holy dip at the Sangam in Maha Kumbh 2025 in a new video shared by a fan on Instagram. At one point, Chris also folded his hands and greeted the fellow devotees at the Sangam.

Paatal Lok 2 to Yeh Kaali Kaali Ankhein 2: The art of making successful sequelOTT platforms are capitalising on the growing demand for sequels as audiences crave familiar characters and stories amid rapid global changes. Netflix India's Tanya Bami and Prime Video India's Nikhil Madhok decode how they green-light a sequel in this week's Cinematic Saturday.

Pic: Emily in Paris actor Lily Collins, husband Charlie McDowell welcome baby girlActor Lily Collins and director Charlie McDowell have become parents to a baby girl via surrogate. They shared the happy news on social media, along with a picture of the baby.

Disgusting: Singer Udit Narayan faces backlash for kissing female fans on lipsUdit Narayan faces criticism for kissing fans: Veteran singer Udit Narayan's videos kissing female fans on their lips during a live performance went viral. The incident has sparked intense reactions online.

Felt like a personal loss: Ishwak Singh on Imran Ansari's death in Paatal Lok 2Actor Ishwak Singh, who plays the role of IPS Ansari in Paatal Lok 2, spoke about the sudden twist in the series when his character is gunned down in Nagaland.

Black Warrant makers on honest portrayal of Ranga-Billa case, and the peacock sceneBlack Warrant creators, Vikramaditya Motwane and Satyanshu Singh, decode how they stayed true to the book, and the portrayal of the Ranga-Billa case in their series.

Marco OTT release: When and where to watch Unni Mukundan's gory thrillerMarco OTT Release Date: After having a phenomenal run at the box office, the Malayalam gore film Marco is set to release on OTT. Starring Unni Mukundan in the lead role, the film will release on Sony LIV in February.

For the love of Korean variety shows In this week's installment of Weekly K-Fix, we discuss a specific genre of Korean entertainment -- their variety shows. From superstars such as BTS and Seventeen, to the beloved MC Yoo Jae-Suk, everyone has appeared in them. Here's a quick look at why they are so popular in South Korea.

Amit Trivedi on using AI in music production: There are flip sides to everythingAmit Trivedi on AI in music: Renowned composer Amit Trivedi shared insights on AI's role in music at a recent event. He emphasised balancing technology with human creativity.

general news.headline: Arvind Kejriwal an 'encyclopaedia of lies', found new ways of corruption: JP NaddaIn conversation with to India Today TV, BJP chief JP Nadda accused Arvind Kejriwal of corruption and deception, calling him an "encyclopaedia of lies," while asserting that Delhi voters are ready to elect a BJP-led government on February 5.

PM quickly got behind tax cut, bureaucrats took convincing: Finance MinisterUnion Budget 2025: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said PM Modi was clear about the need for tax relief, with the ministry working on the proposal. She highlighted efforts to simplify direct taxes and reduce the compliance burden for taxpayers.

Turmoil in Telangana Congress? 10 MLAs hold 'secret' meeting ahead of pollsA secret meeting of 10 Congress MLAs at a farmhouse in Gandipet has ignited speculation and raised concerns of dissent within the ruling party.

Watch: Philadelphia plane crash debris flies into diner, customers run for coverA video surfaced online, showing debris from the plane that crashed in Philadelphia flying into a nearby diner and hitting customers even as they tried to duck for cover.

Hide, work, hide: A day in the life of an Indian illegal immigrant in the USWake up, go to work, return. Repeat. From the outside, a day in the life of an illegal Indian immigrant in the US does not look unusual. But they can neither get a registered job nor a driving licence, and have no legal recourse if they become victims of crime. India Today Digital spoke to several people residing in the US and pieced together a day in the life of an illegal Indian immigrant.

If it were Indira government today, 10 lakhs of Rs 12 lakh would be tax: PMWhile addressing a gathering in RK Puram ahead of Delhi Assembly polls, Prime Minister Narendra Modi claimed that if Indira Gandhi were in power today, those earning Rs 12 lakh annually would have had to pay Rs 10 lakh in taxes.

Shein is back! Reliance relaunches Chinese fashion giant in India after 2020 banFive years after its ban, Chinese fast fashion brand Shein is back in India and is now available on Google Play Store and the Apple App Store.

Rishi Sunak visits Mumbai, shares a pic of himself playing tennis ball cricketIn a post on X, former UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak shared a photograph of him holding a bat as onlookers watched him playing at the iconic Parsee Gymkhana in Mumbai.

Who is Gongadi Trisha? Asia Cup winner, now double world championU19 Women's T20 World Cup: Gongadi Trisha was stupendous throughout the tournament, helping India win the title after beating South Africa in the final on Sunday. The 19-year-old hammered 309 runs and picked up seven wickets.

Video: Samajwadi MP in tears over Dalit woman's rape-murder in AyodhyaOn Saturday, the naked body of a 22-year-old woman was found dumped near a drain outside her village in Ayodhya, sparking widespread outrage.

Shashi Tharoor's fresh take on Hindutva with 'British football hooligan' analogyTharoor made the remarks while addressing a session at the ongoing Jaipur Literature Festival alongside Spanish writer Francesc Miralles, co-author of the global bestseller 'Ikigai'.

Caught on CCTV: Haryana Roadways bus crushes toll workers to evade fee  Gurugram Haryana Roadways: A CCTV footage of the incident showed the Haryana Roadways bus driver speeding through the toll gate, hitting employees in an apparent attempt to evade the toll fee.

Dominant India crush South Africa to clinch second successive titleICC U19 Women's T20 World Cup: A dominant Indian side hammered South Africa by nine wickets in the final to clinch their second successive title in Kuala Lumpur on Sunday, February 2.

Slums in Delhi won't be razed: PM Modi rebuts Arvind Kejriwal ahead of pollsDelhi Polls: Prime Minister Narendra Modi assured Delhi residents that no slums or public welfare schemes will be affected if the BJP comes to power in the national capital.

Manchester United announce Patrick Dorgu as Ruben Amorim's statement signingPatrick Dorgu is officially a Manchester United player as the club announced the signing of the Danish defender on Sunday, February 2. Dorgu signed a lengthy contract with United as Ruben Amorim finally got his big signing.

Ahmedabad auto driver sings Coldplay song while driving, Internet wants him on stage Ahmedabad Coldplay concert viral video: A video of an auto driver singing along to a Coldplay song while driving through the streets of Ahmedabad went viral.

Elon Musk touts DOGE's 120-hour workweek vs US bureaucracy: 'Losing so fast'Elon Musk, who was appointed by Donald Trump to lead DOGE, has positioned the agency as a disruptive force in Washington, aiming to root out inefficiency and corruption in government spending.

UP man took Rs 40,000 loan to fund sister-in-law's gang-rape, murder; arrested A man in Uttar Pradesh took a loan to hire contract killers to murder his sister-in-law. He has been arrested, but the accomplices remain at large. The victim was gang-raped, strangled, and burned.

Jammu and Kashmir storm into quarterfinal with 182-run win vs BarodaRanji Trophy: Jammu and Kashmir hammered Baroda by 182 runs and sealed their place in the quarterfinals of the premier domestic tournament. Jammu & Kashmir, Vidarbha, Haryana, and Saurashtra qualified as the top-ranked teams from their respective groups.

Why did Donald Trump impose tariffs on Mexico, Canada and China?Donald Trump's decision to impose tariffs on China, Canada and Mexico sparked a fierce international dispute, with each nation vowing to take counteraction against 
 the United States.

Himanta Sarma spoils 'Udta Assam party', warns 'local Pablo Escobars'Himanta Biswa Sarma, while warning local drug dealers, shared a video of a tractor smashing a poppy plantation amid a huge police presence.

Can Budget 2025 do what BJP manifesto dreamt of—swinging the Delhi polls?If AAP's 'middle-class manifesto' pushed the BJP-led Centre with big demands, the Budget took several strides to assure this key voting bloc PM Modi's party has their back

Priyanka Chopra takes break from SSMB 29 shoot for brother's wedding in MumbaiActor Priyanka Chopra arrived in Mumbai for her brother's wedding. The actor is in India for the shoot of her upcoming film with SS Rajamouli and Mahesh Babu.

Ramayana The Legend of Prince Rama to have a special screening in ParliamentThe 1993 film Ramayana The Legend of Prince Rama will have a special screening at the Indian Parliament. Lok Sabha speaker Om Birla will also be present at the event.

Sanju Samson should be backed despite long patch of failures: Sanjay ManjrekarFormer India batter Sanjay Manjrekar has backed wicketkeeper-batter Sanju Samson, who is under fire for his poor performances in the ongoing five-match T20I series against England.

Balaji and Bollipalli keep India in World Group I, seal an easy win vs TogoN Sriram Balaji and Rithvik Choudary Bollipalli secured India's spot in the Davis Cup World Group I with a dominant win, giving India an unbeatable 3-0 lead against Togo in the play-off tie.

Agni said that receiving the award from his idol Rohit Sharma meant a lot to him.

Graham Potter on Chelsea sacking: Best thing to have happened to meGraham Potter's return to Stamford Bridge with West Ham promises drama, as the former Chelsea boss looks to prove his managerial growth after a turbulent spell in West London.

Bangladesh appoint independent committee to probe BPL corruption allegationsThe Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) named an independent enquiry committee to assist the Anti-Corruption Unit (ACU) in its ongoing investigation into the Bangladesh Premier League (BPL).

Salah's double in Liverpool's win over Bournemouth, Forest score 7 vs BrightonMohamed Salah's brace powered Liverpool to a crucial win, extending their lead to nine points, while Nottingham Forest ran riot with a stunning 7-0 demolition of Brighton in a goal-packed Premier League night.

U19 Women's T20 World Cup Final Highlights: India defend title with 9-wicket winIndia (IND) vs South Africa (SA), ICC U19 Women's T20 World Cup Final Highlights: India completed back to back title wins, and this time with all-round brilliance in their win over South Africa by nine wickets. Trisha's all-round brilliance shines bright in India's triumph.

Hina Munawar appointed first female manager for Pakistan men's cricket teamThe Pakistan Cricket Board has appointed Hina Munawar as the first female team manager for the Pakistan men's cricket team ahead of the ICC Men's Champions Trophy.

Smith wants Khawaja to open in Ashes after Australia's Sri Lanka winSL vs AUS: Steven Smith backed Usman Khawaja for Australia's Ashes opening spot after his stunning double century against Sri Lanka, praising the veteran batter's resilience and form as Australia fine-tunes preparations for the World Test Championship Final.

5th T20I, Predicted XIs: Will concussion sub Harshit Rana get a look in?India and England are all set to lock horns for the final time in the ongoing T20I series as the action shifts to Mumbai. Will the impressive Harshit Rana get a look in for the 5th T20I after his Pune heroics?

WWE Royal Rumble 2025 Results: Jey Uso breaks John Cena's dream, Charlotte winsWWE Royal Rumble: Jey Uso ended John Cena's dream of winning his final Royal Rumble match as the former Intercontinental Champions booked his ticket for WrestleMania 41. Charlotte Flair returned in grand fashion, while Cody Rhodes and Kevins Owens tore each other apart in an instant classic.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
